title: PHPcheckdnsrr()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPcheckdnsrr()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Check DNS records:
<?php
$domain=".com";
if(checkdnsrr($domain,"MX")) {
echo 
  "Passed";
} else {
echo "Failed";
}
?>
Definition and Usage
The checkdnsrr() function checks DNS records for
type
corresponding to
host
.
We can use the checkdnsrr() function to check our DNS record to verify the existence of a domain name or not.
Syntax
checkdnsrr(
host
,
type
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
host
Required. Specifies an IP address or host name to check
type
Optional. Specifies the type. Can be one of the following:
A
MX (default)
NS
SOA
PTR
CNAME
AAAA
A6
SRV
NAPTR
TXT
ANY
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE if any records are found, FALSE otherwise
PHP Version:
4.0+
PHP Changelog:
PHP 5.3: Now available on Windows platforms
PHP 5.2.4: Added the TXT 
  value of
type

★
+1
